description: From Mexican Spanish marihuana, from mariguana. First attested from 1894 of uncertain origin. Altered by influence of a folk etymology involving the proper name María Juana (“Mary Jane”).

entries.meaning: The inflorescence of the Cannabis sativa plant, smoked or ingested for euphoric effect.
examples: After smoking a bowl of that fine marijuana, they ate some brownies.

entries.meaning: The hemp plant itself, Cannabis sativa.
